newsitem.title: USA: VLSI names former National Semi COO as president, COO.
newsitem.headline: VLSI names former National Semi COO as president, COO.

text.p: VLSI Technology Inc. Wednesday named Richard Beyer, formerly of National Semiconductor Corp., to the post of president and chief operating officer.
Beyer, 47, will also join VLSI's board of directors.

Beyer resigned from National Semiconductor in June, following several other executives who left after former chief executive officer Gilbert Amelio was recruited by Apple Computer Inc. to run that company.
Beyer resigned as chief operating officer after being passed over for the top job at National Semiconductor. Instead, Brian Halla was named to replace Amelio.
At custom-designed chipmaker VLSI, Beyer will assume key management responsibilities previously held by Alfred Stein, who continues in his role as chief executive officer and chairman of the board.
Beyer assumes the title of president from Stein. The chief operating officer title is a newly-created position.
VLSI Technology had 1995 revenues of $720 million, and approximately 3,000 employees worldwide.
